data.title: enjoy
data.text:
had deep dish pizza at greenmill upstairs before the show
everything was good
went downstairs to the theatre to see rise up o men, another in the series of the church basement ladies
the show was delightful
fun entertaining absolutely enjoyable
cast was wonderful
tim drake is a talented fellow

data.title: Disappointing
data.text: First of all, never would have found it as it's located in basement of Green Mills Restaurant. Very small venue. Was looking forward to seeing Church Ladies in the Basement for years. Was okay, but not hilarious although heard others laughing. Definitely not worth $32/person.

data.title: Love this theatre!
data.text:
We visited for a matinee performance of "Rise Up, O Men."  This is a laugh-til-you-cry play.  Loved it! 

It is a small theater with not a bad seat in the place.  You feel engaged with the actors, although (for the most part) they do not involve you in the performance.  They do recognize groups or individuals celebrating something special if you've told them about it.

I recommend calling the box office to purchase your tickets.  There is a $3/order service charge vs. something like a $8/TICKET service charge if you order on line.

One negative comment I have is that I emailed the box office multiple times with questions and never got a response.  They need to get better about monitoring and answering their email.

owner_response.author: Laura W, Group Sales Associate/Social Media Director at Plymouth Playhouse, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hello Coffeemug! 

So happy to hear you enjoyed the performance!

 Online ticketing fees are $3.25 per ticket, but you are absolutely correct that it is much cheaper to order over the phone where the fee is only $3 per order. If you are looking to avoid ticketing fees altogether, you can always walk up to the window to order tickets (provided they are available for the show you'd like) or you can order 10+ tickets and go through our group sales office where there are no service fees and a $6 per ticket discount! 

Sorry to hear about your troubles getting through by email. We are looking for a solution to that issue as we speak. 

Thank you so much for your feedback! We really appreciate the opportunity to improve our service.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Good Clean Funny
data.text: We always try to catch a show at the Plymouth Playhouse when we return to Mpls each summer. This year was another grand slam hit with the men in the kitchen.The play, officially another in the series of the Church Basement Ladies: Rise Up O Men, was another laugh a minute. The ladies were funny as always, with spectacular voices, and the men added their share of laughs this time around. It is a 'regional' themed play, so lots of jokes about historical themes like Norwegian, Swedes, Lutherans, and small town Minnesota. But we always think it is worth our time and money. The actual theater is fine, but the hotel it is located in is rather drab and uninviting...don't let that dissuade you.  Best of all, there is a Broadway Pizza across the parking lot...see my review of the best pizza in the world...Broadway Pizza of the Twin Cities, Minnesota area.

data.title: Big Pants and Botox was disappointing!
data.text: I had heard from a couple people that this play was funny!  We got a good deal through Groupon, but did not realize that there was only 1 person in the play!  I wish I would have read the reviews on this site before I booked the tickets!  We went on the last day of the production and I have never been to a show here before that had only about 30 people there.  There were tons of open seats!  All the other plays that I have seen over the years at this place have been wonderful!  It is a small venue and there really is not a bad seat in the place!

data.title: Couldn't agree with Leigh H more
data.text: Plymouth Playhouse as a whole is a great venue (thus the positive rating) and I'd say most of the times has great shows.   Big Pants & Botox on the other hand, which I was very much looking forward too, thinking it would be incredibly funny, was the worst show I've ever seen...anywhere.  It was not funny at all, which it certainly could have been.  It was very serious and while it had a good moral, I don't believe it is the play that most people were looking for, as I have spoken with others who felt the same way.  Many people I've spoken with felt sorry for the actress, Kim Richards, as they felt that there were parts she was trying to make funny and was waiting for laughter and didn't get it.  I hope management takes note and steers away in the future.

owner_response.author: Laura W, Social Media Director  at Plymouth Playhouse, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for the review! We always appreciate audience feedback.  Hope to see you back at the Playhouse again for one of our outstanding musical comedies.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Disappointing play
data.text: Big Pants and Botox is a disappointing play.  One actress is all there is!  Dialogue is not well written.  The first act is supposed to be comedy but the second act is different and better.  There is a pitch for a charity at the end of the play.  The theater is small and cozy so that you feel comfortable and almost intimate.  Seats and aisles are roomy and sight lines are no problem and it is never a problem to hear.

data.title: Delightful play... small venue makes you feel like you are among friends.
data.text: Because the theater is a small one, it was easy to hear all of the dialogue and singing. Actors had beautiful voices and were talented in what they did. Tickets were very reasonable for a Sunday afternoon. Would definitely see another production there.

owner_response.author: Laura W, Guest Relations Manager at Plymouth Playhouse, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you very much for joining us! Glad to hear you had a pleasant time.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Surprisingly great show! I guess I shouldn't have been...
data.text: We attended the Christmas Frank Sinatra production and was I surprised. The theater was small and intimate and the talent was amazing. We then went to the Green Mill upstairs and some of the performers came in and visited with us. We enjoyed it so much we now have tickets to the upcoming John Denver production in February. Thanks for the great time.

owner_response.author: Laura W, Guest Relations Manager at Plymouth Playhouse, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you very much for attending the show & for the lovely review. We know that you will love Country Roads if you choose to visit again this Spring!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Original Church Basement Ladies
data.text: The show was - like the entire series - fun and entertaining. Had a great time!  The familiar cast (one understudy) was great. They really know their stuff

data.title: Fun; every seat is close to the stage
data.text:
We visited on Sunday, July 12, 2015.  We saw "Church Basement Ladies" at 2:00 pm.

The theater is in the lower level of a hotel.  The place seat 216 and every seat is so close to the stage.

The actors work so well together.  The music and story is great fun.  I laughed so hard that I cried.  Nice intimate venue.

data.title: Church Basement Ladies
data.text: I just saw the summer 2015 production of this show and it was great.  Something I have wanted to do since I moved to Minnesota many years ago.  It was a wonderful production.   I highly recommend it.  I wish they would take the show to Northern California so that my folks could see it.

data.title: Always Quality Shows
data.text:
We have attended several shows at Plymouth Playhouse over the years and always come away pleased and entertained. "Pop Up Musical", "Ring of Fire" and "Church Basement Ladies" come to mind. The seating is the very best with comfortable seats, leg room, and a great view anywhere. It is an intimate setting. Parking is easy. I love being able to see live performances without having to go down town and feel smunched in a crowd. Just plain wonderful.

Our ticket stub would have given us a free drink at the Green MIll Restaurant above. We had other commitments following the performance and did not take advantage of this offer.

data.title: Late Nite Catechism; Not Worth the Hassle
data.text: If you don't like audience interaction and being berated by a nun (it took me back, I admit), then this show is not for you.  She makes you donate to her fund, spit out your gum, and ostracizes and "publics" (those that went to public school).

data.title: A Light Enjoyable Musical
data.text: My husband and I attended "Pop Up Musical" at the Plymouth Playhouse recently and had a enjoyable evening. I love theatre. My husband tolerates this interest:) And music makes my heart sing. We live in the Midwest and during winter, every little bit of uplifting activity help to make it to the long awaited "SPRING" This musical succeeded in doing just that. The musical is a composite of a variety of show tunes with the "pop-up" angle weaving a thread through disassociated plays. It works. It's light. It's fun. Very talented artists, enjoyed every single song and made for a relaxing evening that was just easy. I like the Plymouth Playhouse. We attend theatre in 3 different locations with the Guthrie being one of them. This playhouse is on the small side and comfortable. It feels like viewing the entertainment with family. I have hearing issues and it's always easy for me.

data.title: Great Holiday Show
data.text: The Alley Cats Doo Wop Christmas was playing the weekend after New Year's  Day so my wife and I went to see it.  The Playhouse is in the basement of the Best Western hotel, but it is very spacious, comfortable and has installed new seating since the last time we visited the place.  The Alley Cats featured acapella singing and were funny as well as very good vocalists.  I had not really expected to enjoy the program as much as I did.

data.title: Great Holiday Show!
data.text: A group of us went to the Doo Wop Christmas show with the Alley Cats at the Plymouth Playhouse. We all LOVED it. Their harmony was wonderful-great voices! We enjoyed their singing as well as their humor. I would definitely recommend this show-it will fill you with the holiday spirit

data.title: Amazing Holidy Show!
data.text: The Alley Cats Doo Wop Christmas was stellar!  The Playhouse is cozy- it's in the basement of a hotel, but don't let that scare you away.  It wa fun, sold out, and everyone enjoyed themselves.  Will definitely go back!

data.title: Ring of Fire Johnny Cash
data.text: We went to see Ring of Fire and it was amazing.  The cast was fantastic and it just floored me how every cast member could play all the instruments and sing. And it is such an intimate theater that there is not a bad seat in the house. I will be returning again and again.

data.title: Great entertainment
data.text: We have been to several plays at the Plymouth Playhouse which is located in the lower level of the Kelly Inn.  I can't say enough good things about it.  They have fun entertaining plays that make you feel good when you leave.
